record.description: Five bronze figures (8-10 in.), 2100 B.C.E., found in the city of Nippur in Iraq by a joint expedition of the University of Chicago and the American Schools of Oriental Research at Baghdad. The five pieces were discovered in a brick foundation box of a temple whose patron was either the founder of the third dynasty of Ur, King Ur-Nammu or his son King Shulgi.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Separate caption and attached caption, photographer stamp.
